alert.note: Alert for Western Okanogan County (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Avalanche Warning issued January 12 at 6:51PM PST by NWS Spokane
info.description: The following message is transmitted at the request of the Northwest Avalanche Center. ...The Northwest Avalanche Center in Seattle has issued an Avalanche Warning... * WHAT...High avalanche danger will develop Thursday night and continue on Friday. Very large avalanches may run from upper elevations to valley floors. Wet avalanches may occur on steep slopes in the foothills. * WHERE...The Cascade mountains of western Okanogan County and surrounding foothills. This includes all avalanche terrain from the Canadian Border and south to Lake Chelan including the Washington Pass area and Methow Valley. * WHEN...In effect from now through 6 pm Friday. * PRECAUTIONARY / PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS...Very dangerous avalanche conditions are expected in all elevation bands. Travel in avalanche terrain in not recommended. Avalanches may run long distances and can run into mature forests, valley floors, or flat terrain. Consult https://www.nwac.us/ or www.avalanche.org for more detailed information. Similar avalanche danger may exist at locations outside the coverage area of this or any avalanche center.
